page.title: 01SHAPINSAY
page.content: {Shapinsay}is an island in the centre of Orkney just off the north coast of Scotland in northern Britain. This section is practically in the centre of the island and is typical of most of it. Dotted here and there, are {farmhouses}with surrounding farmlands. Most of the farmers breed cattle. They rear calves which are sold at about two years old. The farmland is very {fertile,}and even in winter the fields are bright green. Unlike other islands in Orkney the former landlord divided out the land very evenly, so the fields are a uniform size.{Farming}methods are progressive. The average size of a farm is 80 to 90 acres. At the present time many of the smallest farms have been swallowed up into existing farms.Now there are fewer families. The population is decreasing.
